trans-unit.source: Handle app resume
trans-unit.target: Handle app resume

trans-unit.source: Learn how to refresh displayed content when the system resumes your app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to refresh displayed content when the system resumes your app.

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Resuming
trans-unit.target: Resuming

trans-unit.source: Learn how to refresh displayed content when the system resumes your app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to refresh displayed content when the system resumes your app.

trans-unit.source: The example in this topic registers an event handler for the [**Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242339) event.
trans-unit.target: The example in this topic registers an event handler for the [**Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242339) event.

trans-unit.source: **Roadmap:** How does this topic relate to others?
trans-unit.target: **Roadmap:** How does this topic relate to others?

trans-unit.target: See:

trans-unit.target: Roadmap for Windows Runtime apps using C# or Visual Basic

trans-unit.target: Roadmap for Windows Runtime apps using C++

trans-unit.source: Register the resuming event handler
trans-unit.target: Register the resuming event handler

trans-unit.source: Register to handle the [**Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242339) event, which indicates that the user switched away from your app and then back to it.
trans-unit.target: Register to handle the [**Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242339) event, which indicates that the user switched away from your app and then back to it.

trans-unit.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
trans-unit.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

trans-unit.source: Refresh displayed content after suspension
trans-unit.target: Refresh displayed content after suspension

trans-unit.source: When your app handles the [**Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242339) event, it has the opportunity to refresh its displayed content.
trans-unit.target: When your app handles the [**Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242339) event, it has the opportunity to refresh its displayed content.

trans-unit.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
trans-unit.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

trans-unit.source: **Note** Because the [**Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242339) event is not raised from the UI thread, a dispatcher must be used to get to the UI thread and inject an update to the UI, if that's something you want to do in your handler.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Because the [**Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242339) event is not raised from the UI thread, a dispatcher must be used to get to the UI thread and inject an update to the UI, if that's something you want to do in your handler.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The system suspends your app whenever the user switches to another app or to the desktop.
trans-unit.target: The system suspends your app whenever the user switches to another app or to the desktop.

trans-unit.source: The system resumes your app whenever the user switches back to it.
trans-unit.target: The system resumes your app whenever the user switches back to it.

trans-unit.source: When the system resumes your app, the content of your variables and data structures is the same as it was before the system suspended the app.
trans-unit.target: When the system resumes your app, the content of your variables and data structures is the same as it was before the system suspended the app.

trans-unit.source: The system restores the app exactly where it left off, so that it appears to the user as if it's been running in the background.
trans-unit.target: The system restores the app exactly where it left off, so that it appears to the user as if it's been running in the background.

trans-unit.source: However, the app may have been suspended for a significant amount of time, so it should refresh any displayed content that might have changed while the app was suspended, such as news feeds or the user's location.
trans-unit.target: However, the app may have been suspended for a significant amount of time, so it should refresh any displayed content that might have changed while the app was suspended, such as news feeds or the user's location.

trans-unit.source: If your app doesn't have any displayed content to refresh, there's no need for it to handle the [**Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242339) event.
trans-unit.target: If your app doesn't have any displayed content to refresh, there's no need for it to handle the [**Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242339) event.

trans-unit.source: **A note about debugging using Visual Studio: ** When your app is attached to the Visual Studio debugger, you can send it a **Resume** event.
trans-unit.target: **A note about debugging using Visual Studio: ** When your app is attached to the Visual Studio debugger, you can send it a **Resume** event.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the **Debug Location toolbar** is being shown, and click the drop-down next to the **Suspend** icon.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the **Debug Location toolbar** is being shown, and click the drop-down next to the **Suspend** icon.

trans-unit.source: Then choose **Resume**.
trans-unit.target: Then choose **Resume**.

trans-unit.source: **Note** For Windows Phone Store apps, the [**Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242339) event is always followed by [**OnLaunched**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242335), even when your app is currently suspended and the user re-launches your app from a primary tile or app list.
trans-unit.target: **Note** For Windows Phone Store apps, the [**Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242339) event is always followed by [**OnLaunched**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242335), even when your app is currently suspended and the user re-launches your app from a primary tile or app list.

trans-unit.source: Apps can skip initialization if there is already content set on the current window.
trans-unit.target: Apps can skip initialization if there is already content set on the current window.

trans-unit.source: You can check the [**LaunchActivatedEventArgs.TileId**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224736) property to determine if the app was launched from a primary or a secondary tile and, based on that information, decide whether you should present a fresh or resume app experience.
trans-unit.target: You can check the [**LaunchActivatedEventArgs.TileId**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224736) property to determine if the app was launched from a primary or a secondary tile and, based on that information, decide whether you should present a fresh or resume app experience.
